newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican navy fishes up 2.3 tons of cocaine.
newsitem.headline: Mexican navy fishes up 2.3 tons of cocaine.

text.p: Mexico's navy scooped up more than two tons of cocaine from the Pacific ocean where it was dumped by a fishing boat, the government said on Friday.
The Attorney-General's office said three navy boats and two helicopters seized 1,106 packets of the drug from the waters off the coast of the state of Guerrero.
The total weight of the haul was 2.3 tons, it said.
Officials said they believed the drugs were dumped to be picked up by speed boats and taken to shore. A routine drug detection flight saw the floating packets, but the fishing boat had disappeared.
